Elliotte Harold wrote:

>We may be talking past each other then. I don't object to new 
>package-private classes and methods as part of refactoring, or in 
>initial design. But we do need to be really clear about distinguishing 
>between public and package-private. I don't think you've always been as 
>clear as you think. For instance, here's a quote from the first message 
>I found from you still in my Inbox:
>  
>
If I haven't been clear in individual messages, then I apologise. 
However, I've stated a number of times in this thread that I start with 
extracted classes as package-private. I also start with non-extracted 
classes as package-private.

However, I don't see any reason not to make them public, and I do so the 
instant I have a driver - classes outside of that package desiring the 
functionality. The need to have a clean API for client developers is 
orthogonal to what classes I make truly public, as it's solved in other 
means (packaging and documentation, mostly).

It is also clear that you don't agree. Very well. Shall we end this 
discussion?

Robert.
